definition: on time/punctual (of train etc)/awesome (slang)
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The train will soon be on schedule.
They're building a new house up the street from me.
sentences.chinese: 他们正点在我住的这条大街的那一头建一栋新房了。

sentences.english: The meeting will start at one o'clock sharp so don't be late.
sentences.chinese: 会议十一点正点准时开始，不要迟到。

sentences.english: Really nicely, from Episode IV, after the first time in listening.
sentences.chinese: 真系好正点，由第四集第一次听左之后。

sentences.english: I＇m confident you＇ve made the right choice.
sentences.chinese: 我相信你已经作了正点确的选择。

sentences.english: There's an airport bus that goes into the city every hour.
sentences.chinese: 每小时都有一班机场交通车去市区，逢正点开出。

sentences.english: Trains run on schedule without mishap.
We're trying to plan our future.
sentences.chinese: 我们正点想法替将来作打算。

sentences.english: Does this flight depart on time?
Different travelling graphs of trains have different proportions of punctuality in the practical application.
sentences.chinese: 不同的列车运行图在实际应用中其正点率不同。

sentences.english: Agent: 15 minutes before the plane takes off. The plane is scheduled to leave on time.
sentences.chinese: 飞机起飞前15分钟，本机正点出发。

sentences.english: If the time is right, however, the sequence of pleasure unfolds.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如果时间正点，阵阵快乐就放栏出来了。

definition: (of trains etc) late/delayed/behind schedule/light dinner
(coll.) not bad/good/fine
time of day exactly on the hour (i.e. 12:00, 1:00 etc)/to make an inventory/(math.) point that has integer coordinates
lit. just the right flavor/just right/just the thing/excellent
midnight snack/late-night snack
to one's taste/tasty/fig. sth one enjoys
as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
energetic/exciting/of interest
dining car/diner
to serve a meal
swift/agile/efficient/quick-witted (colloquial)
(of fruit etc) fresh/(of a person etc) full of life/healthy-looking/(of eyes) moist and bright/lustrous
midnight snack
it's time (to do sth)/the time has come
to stop work for the day (generally of laborers)/to knock off
meal/to eat/classifier for meals
